definition: to strike off (the rolls)/to remove from a list/to expunge/to expel
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: She was dumped from the company after all those years.
sentences.chinese: 在經過那麼多年後她被公司除名了。

sentences.english: The new boss was determined to rid the company of all slackers.
sentences.chinese: 公司決定新人資老闆可將公司所有偷懶者除名。

sentences.english: He couldn't run fast enough, so the coach dropped him.
sentences.chinese: 他跑得不夠快，所以教練把他除名了。

sentences.english: The boss dropped her from the staff after three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 三週後老闆把她從職員中除名了。

sentences.english: The boy is removed from school.
If you get arrested, you're off the Assault Committee.
sentences.chinese: 如果你被捕，那就從突擊小組裏除名。

sentences.english: Japan's LDP leadership plans to give Hamada "removal" action.
sentences.chinese: 日本自民黨領導層計劃給予濱田“除名”處分。

sentences.english: They were chucked out of the club for failing to pay the membership dues.
sentences.chinese: 他們由於不繳納會費而被俱樂部除名。

sentences.english: He was struck off the lawyer register.
sentences.chinese: 在註冊律師名單上，他已被除名。

sentences.english: It is embarrassing for Dresden to be the only place delisted against its will;
sentences.chinese: 德雷斯頓作爲唯一非自願被除名的地方，令人尷尬。

sentences.english: He's been dropped from the boxing team.
The old physician was unfrocked by the Medical Association.
sentences.chinese: 這位老醫生被醫師公會除名。

sentences.english: You weren't sad to see Kuranyi go.
sentences.chinese: 庫蘭伊被除名，你並不感到難過。

sentences.english: He has been quietly dropped from the England team.
sentences.chinese: 他被暗地裏從英格蘭隊中除名了。

sentences.english: With five unexcused absences you will be withdrawn from the class.
sentences.chinese: 無理由地缺席五次，你將被這門課除名。

sentences.english: The minister was later to be sacked by you-know-who.
sentences.chinese: 部長其後被那小我除名了，你知道他是誰。

definition: to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
